title: Behavior of a function based on derivative graph

content.question: The figure above shows the graph of <math> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>â€²</mo> </msup> </math>, the derivative of function <math> <mi>f</mi> </math>, for <math> <mrow> <mo>-</mo> <mn>6</mn> <mo><</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo><</mo> <mn>8</mn> </mrow> </math>. Of the following, which best describes the graph of <math> <mi>f</mi> </math> on the same interval?

choices.label: 1 relative minimum, 1 relative maximum, and 3 points of inflection
1 relative minimum, 1 relative maximum, and 4 points of inflection
2 relative minima, 1 relative maximum, and 2 points of inflection
2 relative minima, 1 relative maximum, and 4 points of inflection
2 relative minima, 2 relative maxima, and 3 points of inflection

content.answer: 1 relative minimum, 1 relative maximum, and 3 points of inflection

topic.text: 5.9: Connecting a Function, Its First Derivative, and Its Second Derivative

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
